intro: Argostemma mjoebergii, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its showy, nocturnal flowers that open at night. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and a prominent white throat. It thrives in woodland and grassland habitats, often in partial shade.
